elements.title: seven-spot ladybirds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an estimated 23 billion seven-spot ladybirds (example pictured) swarmed England's eastern and southern coasts during a heatwave in 1976?

elements.title: Bill Cottrell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bill Cottrell went from playing for a high-school team that had 32 consecutive losses to starting for an NFL team?

elements.title: fluier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a type of flute known as a fluier was sometimes built into Romanian shepherds' whips and staffs?

elements.title: J. Harry Benrimo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actor and playwright J. Harry Benrimo has been described as a "central and versatile figure in Orientalist theater"?

elements.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1961 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lale Andersen, who was popular with both sides of World War II for her version of "Lili Marleen", represented Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest 1961?

elements.title: Suprapto Martosetomo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Suprapto Martosetomo sheltered Indonesian students at his residence in the Philippines during a 1989 coup attempt?

elements.title: Variations on a Theme from La Cenerentola (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Variations on a Theme from La Cenerentola are attributed to Frédéric Chopin, but he may only have composed one of the variations?

elements.title: Li Xinchuan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Li Xinchuan was allowed to return to his old workplace after fleeing the Mongol invasion?

elements.title: The Little Hours (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aubrey Plaza got high with the "weed nuns" to promote The Little Hours?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

El Cuyo beckons to visitors looking for a quiet, natural seaside town to bask in the sun undisturbed by revelers while other visitors seek adrenaline-pumping excitement.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Dehydration

A condition that may affect travellers in many places and for many reasons. Never pleasant, sometimes fatal.
